dataset.title: Population dynamics of young forest stands as affected by density and nutrient regime in the Andrews Experimental Forest

additionalInfo.para:
the changes listed below were made before moving to sql server:
format 2 had the 1981 remeasurement and was renamed to tp882.old
the new format 2 combines
tp882 (1981), tp884 (1983), tp889 (1985), tp8812 (1987), and tp8815 (1996)
into a single file.
the 1993 remeasurement (rem93.dbf) in the old fsdb was not included because the field work was deficient.

intellectualRights.para: Welcome to the H. J. Andrews LTER Database. Our intentions are to make our data as freely available as possible (See Data Availability). Our data sets consist of long-term research study data with accompanying documentation (metadata). Spatial and non-spatial data sets are available as well as software and models. We encourage the use of our data sets, but as a professional courtesy we ask that data users read and agree to the terms of our Data Use Agreement. It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists that results in data used in subsequent research. Therefore, Andrews Forest researchers request appropriate citation and acknowledgement for subsequent distribution or publication of any work derived from these data sets. Data users are strongly encouraged to consider consultation, collaboration and/or co-authorship with original investigators.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Oregon Western Cascades, H.J. Andrews Experimental Forest

section.title: Experimental Design - TP088
section.para: Four replications of 3 density levels each. In a split-plot design we will establish two urea fertilization treatments (fertilized and unfertilized) in each density level, and two pruning treatments (pruned and unpruned) in each fertilization treatment.This establishes 12 treatment combinations per replication.Within each treatment combination a 50 tree measurement plot will be established.

section.title: Field Methods - TP088
section.para: Thinning - density reduced to 15% and 25% of maximum stand density. Fertilization - area added at 50kg/ha/year until new September foliage contains 2% N. Additional applications to maintain this level. Pruning - the meet crown width criterion (see study plan). Height, diameter, and sapwood area will be measured for a sample of trees every second year.
